sourceDesc.bibl: 2014 por el Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Obtained from:

normalization.ab: Saltillos in original contents converted to apostrophe's, original form with saltillo preserved in value of @orig.

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //list/item/w[@xml:lang='mix']
Spanish translations are part of original content and are found at following location: //list/item/w[@xml:lang='es']

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //list/item/linkGrp[@type='translation']/link[@target and the two equivalent translation values are defined in the value of //link[@target]

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //list/item/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent

spanGrp.span: Species of crow found in la Mixteca can be further specified. More Research needed.
Not sure of specific variety of 'chachalaca'.

span.note: Not entirely certain of the specific subspecies of Thrasher, but judging from the content of the following Wikipedia article: it seems most likely that it is the Ocellated Thrasher.

Not clear whether this bird is referring to the Woodhouse's Scrub Jay or the Mexican Scub Jay as their territories overlap and may both be found in La Mixtec (at least according to the maps found in the following locations: . However based on the picture in the document, it would appear to be a Woodhouse's Scrub Jay as each have a clear white line over the eye brows.

spanGrp.span: The original Spanish species name appears to be misspelled as it should beEufonia gorro azul.
Troglidita is the non-standard Spanish name for a type of Wren but not sure which one.
Listed source ambiguous as to specific type of Nuthatch.
Not sure if the species is the Green Heron (Butorides virescens) or Blue Heron
Not sure what specific type of Heron is intended. The external references are for the general Heron family of birds.
